citations.narrative:
Many rabbit droppings are on the ground and in fallen hay next to the bales stored on pallets. The feedstuff is intended for
consumption by the camels. A wild rabbit was observed outside of the outdoor food storage facility during inspection. A
facility representative stated there is no current pest control program for rabbits, but there is one for rodents. Failure to
have an active program to control mammalian pests may result in disease transmission and thus illness in animals. A safe
and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be established and
maintained.
Correct by 22 November 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
Many rabbit droppings are on the ground and in fallen hay next to the bales stored on pallets. The feedstuff is intended for 
consumption by the camels. A wild rabbit was observed outside of the outdoor food storage facility during inspection. A 
facility representative stated there is no current pest control program for rabbits, but there is one for rodents. Failure to 
have an active program to control mammalian pests may result in disease transmission and thus illness in animals. A safe 
and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be established and 
maintained. 
 
Correct by 22 November 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
 n
